newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador says Enron in oil pipeline project.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador says Enron in oil pipeline project.

text.p: A foreign consortium including U.S. firm Enron Corp will begin to construct a new oil pipeline in Ecuador in 45 days, Energy and Mines Minister Alfredo Adum said Thursday.

Adum told local television that William Brothers, Brazil's Odebrecht, Argentina's Techint and Enron would build a pipeline to carry 130,000 barrels of oil a day through the Amazonian jungle to the coast.
The new pipeline would accompany an existing duct which has a capacity of 320,000 barrels a day.
"They are coming to build the pipeline with their own money and they will begin to build the pipeline within 45 days at the latest," said Adum.

The announcement came a day after the government announced it was reexamining all contracts with foreign oil companies. Late Tuesday, the government banned Argentine-owned Maxus Energy Corp from continuing its operations in Ecuador until it reaches a joint-venture deal with state-owned Petroecuador.
